input: Suppose it's true that B: and, you know, they just love kittens. A: Yeah. B: They just are fascinated. A: Oh, yeah. B: So she doesn't know that this is a cat yet. Then, is "this is a cat" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that But what we may not know is just what makes somebody a sucker.  What makes people blurt out their credit-card numbers to a caller they 've never heard of? Do they really believe that the number is just for verification and is simply a formality on the road to being a grand-prize winner? Then, is "the number is just for verification and is simply a formality on the road to being a grand-prize winner" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that Louise was equally anxious to see this man who had had the power to persuade her niece to go against her upbringing and character and behave so recklessly after such a brief acquaintance. Waiting in the airport she was suddenly aware of Nora striding towards her. She was impressed by how elegant she looked and could tell by her cousin's walk that Nora also felt that she was looking good. Then, is "that Nora also felt that she was looking good" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that B: how'd you like to own a piece of property where your lake is going sour because of acid rain. A: Right.  Right. B: It's, uh, really a serious issue for those of us up in this, uh, sector up here. A: um, or do you hypothesize that most of the, uh, smog or air pollution comes from vehicles Then, is "most of the smog or air pollution comes from vehicles" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that He left his own number, calling himself Alain - the name of her Malaysian-French ``business manager''. The next day Gina rang. She had obviously not noticed that it was her own number. Then, is "it was Gina's own number" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that B: And she got kind of fearful of being on her own. She never really ate very well. It was one thing. She hardly ever took care of herself A: Yeah. B: and she didn't eat. She ate very poor so I think she was, you know, bad, uh, nutrition on top of it. And, uh, she got to the point she didn't want to alone anymore. So, A: So often I think though, elderly people don't realize that their diet is that bad. Then, is "elderly people's diet is that bad" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that B: And yet, uh, I we-, I hope to see employer based, you know, helping out. You know, child, uh, care centers at the place of employment and things like that, that will help out. A: Uh-huh. B: What do you think, do you think we are, setting a trend? Then, is "they are setting a trend" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that B: uh, but it's worked out for my family, to have my cake and eat it too, kind of thing. A: Yeah.  Yeah, that's a good deal. Where do you think this is going in the future, I mean, do you think things are going to change, Then, is "things are going to change" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that The assassin's tone and bearing were completely confident. If he noticed that Zukov was now edging further to the side widening the arc of fire he did not appear to be troubled. Then, is "Zukov was edging further to the side" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that A: and that rolling kind of, uh, B: Terrain. A: Yeah. is fairly famili-,. The thing that I thought was interesting was that the critics, apparently it's going to win everything. B: Really? A: Uh, and I had been told, you know, you wouldn't notice that it was three hours long, and all this, kind of, Then, is "it was three hours long" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that She hated to think of his sister lying in hospital waiting for her husband to come to her while all the time he was with Dana. She gripped her hands tightly together. Dana didn't know Berenice was in danger of losing her child. Then, is "Berenice was in danger of losing her child" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that A: I'm like, I'll get a job some day and my boss will pay for it, I'll be needed. B: Yeah. A: Because, um, I didn't want to go do it myself because I didn't think I was really going to use it. Then, is "he was really going to use it" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that During that pause I realized that Mala had not been offered a seat, nor any food or drink. The Emissary and his people were behaving as if she simply wasn't there. I could see that she was scowling and stiffening into a Mark 2 temper so I gave her an encouraging smile - which raised her as I expected to a Mark 3. Then, is "Mala was scowling and stiffening into a Mark 2 temper" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that 'Very well, I'll go. But I pick my own men, and if we ever have to fight, you obey my word.'' Jehan did not think that Sidacai was in any position to impose conditions but he sat back in his chair considering. Then, is "Sidacai was in a position to impose conditions" always, sometimes, or never true?
Suppose it's true that ``Who knows? The point is, do we go with it or not?'' Do we assume there is a shipment? Then, is "there is a shipment" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that And I don't want to have to lie to them. The kidnappers have given us until October the eleventh to deliver the document and I haven't despaired of finding it before then. But if the police learn I 've been to America they 'll ask why. Then, is "he's been to America" always, sometimes, or never true?

Suppose it's true that A: And I haven't quite figured that out, if they figure they have got it won or if there's no real hurry because the first three quarters or, uh, uh, if something happens that that adrenalin starts flowing. They say, hey, we got to do something now. And then start playing the game the way the game should be played toward the last few minutes. B: Yeah. A: So, I don't know I'm looking for a good year. I guess we're always looking for a good year. B: So, obviously though, do you think they're going to do anything in the playoffs to make it to the Super Bowl this year Then, is "they're going to do anything in the playoffs to make it to the Super Bowl this year" always, sometimes, or never true?
